meanings.definition: To deliberately underperform in a competition or activity in order to deceive others.
meanings.sent1: During the game, he was sandbagging to make his opponent think he was not a strong player.
meanings.sent2: She was accused of sandbagging in the race to secure an easier opponent in the next round.
meanings.sent3: The magician was sandbagging his tricks to surprise the audience with his real skills later.
meanings.sent4: The spy was sandbagging his cover story to mislead the enemy agents.
meanings.sent5: The student was sandbagging his test performance to lower expectations and then ace the final exam.
